item.title: How to Slice Requirements to Continuously Deliver Value: Vertical Slicing
item.description: When working on a software project of a certain size, we have to divide (slice, or “slice”) larger requirements into smaller, more manageable tasks. There are two ways to do this division: horizontal slicing and vertical slicing. When we do horizontal slicing, we divide by a technical criterion (usually layers). We have one task for the front end, another for the back end, another for the database, etc. This approach presents us with 2 problems
